summary: Global encompasses themes of worldwide connectivity, technological impact, and internet fragmentation. It explores Marshall McLuhan's concept of the global village, highlighting how digital connectivity leads to tribal conflicts rather than unification. The term also delves into the evolving landscape of the internet, comparing its fragmentation to geological processes and examining ecosystem architecture. It touches on the importance of preserving internet diversity, fostering innovation, and resisting uniformity in the digital realm.
excerpt: Global connectivity through technology leads to tribal conflicts rather than unification, as seen in internet debates. The fragmentation of the digital landscape mirrors tectonic shifts, offering opportunities for innovation and diversity in our interconnected world.
